back_cards.definition_en: To evaluate or judge the value or quality of something.
back_cards.example_en: We need to assess the damage to the car before filing an insurance claim.

back_cards.definition_en: To determine the importance or impact of a situation.
back_cards.example_en: The team met to assess how the new policy might affect our workflow.

back_cards.definition_en: To estimate or calculate an amount, like taxes or costs.
back_cards.example_en: The city will assess property values to set next year’s taxes.

back_cards.definition_en: To analyze someone’s skills or performance.
back_cards.example_en: The coach will assess each player’s strengths during practice.

back_cards.definition_en: To review or size up a challenge or task.
back_cards.example_en: She paused to assess the steep trail before starting the hike.

back_cards.definition_en: Firm or strong, not easily broken or changed.
back_cards.example_en: The table is made of solid oak and will last for years.

back_cards.definition_en: Reliable or dependable, often describing a person or plan.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a solid worker who always gets the job done on time.

back_cards.definition_en: Uninterrupted or continuous, without gaps.
back_cards.example_en: We worked for three solid hours to finish the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Substantial or satisfying, like food or results.
back_cards.example_en: That was a solid meal; I’m not hungry anymore.

back_cards.definition_en: Consistent or unified, as in agreement or support.
back_cards.example_en: The team showed solid support for the new strategy.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a tree that grows out from the trunk.
back_cards.example_en: The bird perched on a branch high above the garden.

back_cards.definition_en: A local office or division of a larger organization.
back_cards.example_en: I need to visit the bank’s downtown branch to open an account.

back_cards.definition_en: A section or category of something, like knowledge.
back_cards.example_en: Her favorite branch of science is marine biology.

back_cards.definition_en: A smaller stream or river flowing into a larger one.
back_cards.example_en: The branch of the river near our house is great for fishing.

back_cards.definition_en: A line of family descent or extension.
back_cards.example_en: That branch of the family moved to California years ago.

back_cards.definition_en: Very angry or upset.
back_cards.example_en: She was mad when she found out her phone was broken.

back_cards.definition_en: Crazy or wild, often in an exciting way.
back_cards.example_en: The party last night was mad fun with all the dancing.

back_cards.definition_en: Irrational or foolish, as in behavior or ideas.
back_cards.example_en: It’s mad to go hiking in this storm without gear.

back_cards.definition_en: Extremely enthusiastic or obsessed with something.
back_cards.example_en: He’s mad about vintage cars and owns three of them.

back_cards.definition_en: Intense or extreme, often used for emphasis.
back_cards.example_en: The new restaurant has mad good burgers you’ve got to try.

back_cards.definition_en: To a moderate degree or extent.
example “‘How’s the project going?’ ‘It’s somewhat challenging, but we’re managing.’
Slightly or partly, not fully.
back_cards.example_en: I’m somewhat tired after the long meeting this morning.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to soften or qualify a statement.
back_cards.example_en: The movie was somewhat predictable, but still enjoyable.

back_cards.definition_en: To a certain level, often vague or unclear.
back_cards.example_en: His explanation was somewhat confusing, so I asked for clarification.

back_cards.definition_en: Moderately, in terms of progress or change.
back_cards.example_en: The weather’s improved somewhat, but it’s still chilly outside.

back_cards.definition_en: A polite or courteous man.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a true gentleman, always holding the door for others.

back_cards.definition_en: A man of good social standing or manners.
back_cards.example_en: The gentleman in the suit greeted everyone at the gala.

back_cards.definition_en: A respectful way to refer to a man in formal settings.
back_cards.example_en: May I speak with the gentleman who called earlier?

back_cards.definition_en: A man who behaves honorably or kindly.
back_cards.example_en: He was a gentleman and offered to help with my bags.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to address men collectively in a polite way.
back_cards.example_en: Ladies and gentlemen, please take your seats for the show.

back_cards.definition_en: Disagreement or resistance to a plan or idea.
back_cards.example_en: The new policy faced strong opposition from the community.

back_cards.definition_en: The group or party against a ruling authority.
back_cards.example_en: The opposition party proposed a different budget plan.

back_cards.definition_en: A contrast or difference between two things.
back_cards.example_en: Her calm demeanor was in opposition to his fiery speech.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of opposing or challenging something.
back_cards.example_en: There was no opposition to the team’s decision to move forward.

back_cards.definition_en: A competing team or rival in a contest.
back_cards.example_en: Our soccer team easily beat the opposition last night.

back_cards.definition_en: To believe someone may be guilty of something.
back_cards.example_en: The police suspect he was involved in the robbery.

back_cards.definition_en: To doubt or question the truth of something.
back_cards.example_en: I suspect her story about being late isn’t entirely true.

back_cards.definition_en: To think something is likely without proof.
back_cards.example_en: I suspect it’ll rain this afternoon based on those clouds.

back_cards.definition_en: A person thought to have committed a crime.
back_cards.example_en: The suspect was seen leaving the scene in a red car.

back_cards.definition_en: To have a hunch or feeling about something.
back_cards.example_en: She suspected he was planning a surprise for her birthday.

back_cards.definition_en: To the side or out of the way.
back_cards.example_en: He stepped aside to let the kids run past.

back_cards.definition_en: A comment spoken quietly, not meant for all to hear.
back_cards.example_en: She whispered an aside to her friend during the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Temporarily setting something apart or ignoring it.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s put our differences aside and finish this project.

back_cards.definition_en: In reserve or saved for later use.
back_cards.example_en: I set some money aside for a weekend getaway.

back_cards.definition_en: Away from the main focus or topic.
back_cards.example_en: Joking aside, we need to focus on the deadline.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who competes in sports or physical activities.
back_cards.example_en: She’s an athlete who trains daily for the marathon.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone skilled in physical strength or agility.
back_cards.example_en: The gymnast showed why she’s a top athlete.

back_cards.definition_en: A participant in competitive team sports.
back_cards.example_en: Our school’s athletes won the state championship.

back_cards.definition_en: A person dedicated to fitness and performance.
back_cards.example_en: He’s an athlete who tracks every workout carefully.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone admired for physical prowess in a sport.
back_cards.example_en: The young athlete inspired fans with her determination.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of starting or beginning something.
back_cards.example_en: The opening of the new store drew a huge crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: A gap or hole that allows entry or passage.
back_cards.example_en: We crawled through the opening in the fence.

back_cards.definition_en: The first part of an event or performance.
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s opening scene was absolutely thrilling.

back_cards.definition_en: A job or opportunity available to apply for.
back_cards.example_en: There’s an opening for a manager at the coffee shop.

back_cards.definition_en: A chance to start or introduce something new.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech was a great opening for the conference.

back_cards.definition_en: A request or expression of thanks to a deity.
back_cards.example_en: She said a prayer for her family’s safety.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal act of worship or spiritual communication.
back_cards.example_en: The congregation joined in prayer during the service.

back_cards.definition_en: A sincere hope or wish for something.
back_cards.example_en: My prayer is that everyone finds peace this year.

back_cards.definition_en: A set text recited in religious ceremonies.
back_cards.example_en: He memorized the prayer for the evening ritual.

back_cards.definition_en: An earnest plea or entreaty for help.
back_cards.example_en: Her prayer for strength got her through tough times.

back_cards.definition_en: Happening often or regularly.
back_cards.example_en: I frequently visit the park to jog in the mornings.

back_cards.definition_en: Occurring at short intervals or repeatedly.
back_cards.example_en: She checks her phone frequently during meetings.

back_cards.definition_en: Commonly or usually, in many instances.
back_cards.example_en: This café is frequently packed on weekends.

back_cards.definition_en: Habitually or as a common practice.
back_cards.example_en: He frequently forgets to lock the back door.

back_cards.definition_en: Done often in a specific context or routine.
back_cards.example_en: They frequently travel for work, almost every month.

back_cards.definition_en: To hire or use someone for a job.
back_cards.example_en: The company plans to employ ten new workers.

back_cards.definition_en: To use something for a specific purpose.
back_cards.example_en: She employed a new strategy to boost sales.

back_cards.definition_en: To engage or occupy someone’s time or effort.
back_cards.example_en: The project employed all our resources for weeks.

back_cards.definition_en: To put into service or apply effectively.
back_cards.example_en: He employed his charm to win over the client.

back_cards.definition_en: To provide work or a role for someone.
back_cards.example_en: The school employs teachers with diverse backgrounds.

back_cards.definition_en: A sport played with a ball and hoops.
back_cards.example_en: We played basketball in the driveway until dark.

back_cards.definition_en: The ball used in the sport of basketball.
back_cards.example_en: He forgot his basketball at the gym yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: A game between two teams on a court.
back_cards.example_en: The basketball match went into overtime last night.

back_cards.definition_en: A popular activity in schools or communities.
back_cards.example_en: Our school’s basketball team is practicing hard.

back_cards.definition_en: A cultural event or competition involving the sport.
back_cards.example_en: The community hosts a basketball tournament every summer.

back_cards.definition_en: Currently in place or already present.
back_cards.example_en: We need to work with the existing budget for now.

back_cards.definition_en: In operation or currently functioning.
back_cards.example_en: The existing rules don’t allow pets in the building.

back_cards.definition_en: Already established or available.
back_cards.example_en: She upgraded the existing software on her laptop.

back_cards.definition_en: Continuing to exist or remain in use.
back_cards.example_en: The existing bridge needs repairs to stay safe.

back_cards.definition_en: Presently occurring or in effect.
back_cards.example_en: Our existing plan should cover the project’s needs.

back_cards.definition_en: A major change in government or social order.
back_cards.example_en: The revolution led to a new democratic system.

back_cards.definition_en: A dramatic shift in ideas or technology.
back_cards.example_en: The smartphone sparked a revolution in communication.

back_cards.definition_en: A complete cycle or turn, like in mechanics.
back_cards.example_en: The wheel makes one revolution every second.

back_cards.definition_en: A radical transformation in a field or practice.
back_cards.example_en: Her work started a revolution in modern art.

back_cards.definition_en: A movement to overthrow an established system.
back_cards.example_en: The people united for a revolution against unfair laws.

back_cards.definition_en: To press a button on a mouse or device.
back_cards.example_en: Just click the link to open the website.

back_cards.definition_en: A short, sharp sound made by something.
back_cards.example_en: The door lock made a loud click when it shut.

back_cards.definition_en: To connect or understand something suddenly.
back_cards.example_en: It finally clicked how to solve the puzzle.

back_cards.definition_en: To get along well or instantly bond.
back_cards.example_en: We met at the party and just clicked right away.

back_cards.definition_en: To select or activate something digitally.
back_cards.example_en: Click ‘save’ to keep your changes to the file.

back_cards.definition_en: A strong feeling like happiness or anger.
back_cards.example_en: Her voice trembled with emotion during the speech.

back_cards.definition_en: A reaction to a personal or intense experience.
back_cards.example_en: He couldn’t hide his emotion when he saw his family.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of mind influenced by feelings.
back_cards.example_en: The movie stirred deep emotions in the audience.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to express inner thoughts or reactions.
back_cards.example_en: She channeled her emotion into writing poetry.

back_cards.definition_en: A powerful response to a situation or event.
back_cards.example_en: His apology was full of genuine emotion.

back_cards.definition_en: A raised surface for standing or performing.
back_cards.example_en: The speaker stood on the platform to address the crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: A digital system or software for specific uses.
back_cards.example_en: This platform lets you stream movies and shows.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of beliefs or policies, especially political.
back_cards.example_en: Her campaign platform focused on education reform.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure for boarding trains or buses.
back_cards.example_en: The train leaves from platform three in ten minutes.

back_cards.definition_en: A foundation for building or launching something.
back_cards.example_en: The app provides a platform for local artists.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure that holds or supports something.
back_cards.example_en: The picture frame hangs above the fireplace.

back_cards.definition_en: To construct or build something.
back_cards.example_en: They plan to frame the new house next week.

back_cards.definition_en: The structure of a person’s body or build.
back_cards.example_en: He has a tall, lean frame from years of running.

back_cards.definition_en: To falsely make someone seem guilty.
back_cards.example_en: The evidence was planted to frame an innocent man.

back_cards.definition_en: A single image in a sequence, like in film.
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s opening frame was a stunning sunset.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a strong request or plea.
back_cards.example_en: She made an appeal for donations to help the shelter.

back_cards.definition_en: To challenge a legal decision in court.
back_cards.example_en: The lawyer filed an appeal to overturn the verdict.

back_cards.definition_en: The power to attract or interest someone.
back_cards.example_en: The beach town has a lot of appeal for tourists.

back_cards.definition_en: To seem attractive or desirable.
back_cards.example_en: The idea of a quiet weekend appeals to me.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal call for help or support.
back_cards.example_en: The charity’s appeal raised thousands for the cause.

back_cards.definition_en: To repeat someone’s exact words.
back_cards.example_en: She quoted her favorite poet during the speech.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific saying or phrase from someone.
back_cards.example_en: That quote from the movie always makes me laugh.

back_cards.definition_en: To provide an estimated cost for a service.
back_cards.example_en: The mechanic gave me a quote for the car repair.

back_cards.definition_en: To cite or reference something as evidence.
back_cards.example_en: He quoted a study to support his argument.

back_cards.definition_en: A memorable line often used for inspiration.
back_cards.example_en: The coach shared a quote to motivate the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific type or make of a product.
back_cards.example_en: I prefer this brand of coffee over others.

back_cards.definition_en: A company’s logo or identity.
back_cards.example_en: The brand’s new logo is bold and colorful.

back_cards.definition_en: To mark something as a way to identify it.
back_cards.example_en: The ranch brands its cattle with a unique symbol.

back_cards.definition_en: A reputation or image associated with something.
back_cards.example_en: Her personal brand is all about positivity.

back_cards.definition_en: To label or promote a product distinctly.
back_cards.example_en: They brand their snacks as healthy and organic.

back_cards.definition_en: To make something possible or allow it to happen.
back_cards.example_en: The new software will enable faster data processing.

back_cards.definition_en: To give someone the ability or means to do something.
back_cards.example_en: This grant will enable her to finish her degree.

back_cards.definition_en: To activate or turn on a feature or system.
back_cards.example_en: You need to enable notifications to get updates.

back_cards.definition_en: To support or facilitate an action or process.
back_cards.example_en: The app enables users to track their workouts.

back_cards.definition_en: To empower or provide opportunities for someone.
back_cards.example_en: The training program enables employees to grow.

back_cards.definition_en: Laws made by a government or authority.
back_cards.example_en: The new legislation aims to protect the environment.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of creating or passing laws.
back_cards.example_en: Congress is debating legislation on healthcare reform.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of rules or regulations enacted.
back_cards.example_en: The legislation requires businesses to reduce emissions.

back_cards.definition_en: Proposed laws under consideration.
back_cards.example_en: The senator introduced legislation to improve schools.

back_cards.definition_en: Legal measures addressing specific issues.
back_cards.example_en: This legislation will change how taxes are collected.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of adding something to another.
back_cards.example_en: The addition of spices made the dish taste better.

back_cards.definition_en: Something added to improve or expand.
back_cards.example_en: The new wing is an addition to the hospital.

back_cards.definition_en: The mathematical process of combining numbers.
back_cards.example_en: She taught the kids addition using colorful blocks.

back_cards.definition_en: An extra feature or enhancement.
back_cards.example_en: The car’s sunroof is a nice addition to the model.

back_cards.definition_en: Including something as part of a whole.
back_cards.example_en: His skills are a great addition to the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for scientific experiments or research.
back_cards.example_en: She works in a lab studying plant genetics.

back_cards.definition_en: A room for conducting tests or analysis.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor sent my sample to the lab for testing.

back_cards.definition_en: Short for laboratory, often used in schools.
back_cards.example_en: We’re doing a chemistry experiment in the lab today.

back_cards.definition_en: A space for developing new technology or products.
back_cards.example_en: The tech company’s lab created a new app.

back_cards.definition_en: A workplace for hands-on learning or practice.
back_cards.example_en: The computer lab is open for students all day.

back_cards.definition_en: To disagree with or resist something.
back_cards.example_en: Many residents oppose the new highway plan.

back_cards.definition_en: To actively work against a proposal or idea.
back_cards.example_en: She decided to oppose the policy at the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: To stand in the way or act as an obstacle.
back_cards.example_en: No one dared to oppose his leadership.

back_cards.definition_en: To contrast or be different from something.
back_cards.example_en: His views oppose mine on this issue completely.

back_cards.definition_en: To challenge or compete against someone.
back_cards.example_en: The team will oppose their rivals in the finals.

back_cards.definition_en: A line of things or people arranged side by side.
back_cards.example_en: The chairs were set up in a neat row.

back_cards.definition_en: To propel a boat using oars.
back_cards.example_en: We decided to row across the lake this morning.

back_cards.definition_en: A noisy argument or disagreement.
back_cards.example_en: They had a big row over who should clean up.

back_cards.definition_en: A sequence or series of items.
back_cards.example_en: She planted a row of flowers along the fence.

back_cards.definition_en: A trip or journey in a rowboat.
back_cards.example_en: The row to the island was peaceful and scenic.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of moving to a new country to live.
back_cards.example_en: Her family’s immigration to the U.S. was challenging.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of entering a country legally.
back_cards.example_en: Immigration laws require a valid visa for entry.

back_cards.definition_en: The movement of people across borders.
back_cards.example_en: Immigration has shaped the city’s diverse culture.

back_cards.definition_en: The system handling newcomers to a country.
back_cards.example_en: The immigration office was busy processing applications.

back_cards.definition_en: The experience of settling in a new nation.
back_cards.example_en: His immigration story inspired many at the event.

back_cards.definition_en: Something valuable or useful owned by someone.
back_cards.example_en: Her quick thinking is an asset to the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of property or equipment.
back_cards.example_en: The company sold some assets to raise funds.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial resource, like money or stocks.
back_cards.example_en: Real estate is a major asset in his portfolio.

back_cards.definition_en: A person’s skills or qualities that are useful.
back_cards.example_en: His language skills are a huge asset at work.

back_cards.definition_en: Anything that adds value or benefit.
back_cards.example_en: The new software is an asset for productivity.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of watching or noticing something carefully.
back_cards.example_en: Her observation of the birds helped her study.

back_cards.definition_en: A comment or remark based on what’s seen.
back_cards.example_en: He made an observation about the project’s progress.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of collecting data or information.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist’s observation confirmed the hypothesis.

back_cards.definition_en: Close attention to details or patterns.
back_cards.example_en: Her keen observation caught the error in the report.

back_cards.definition_en: A statement reflecting personal insight.
back_cards.example_en: His observation about the weather was spot on.

back_cards.definition_en: The sense of flavor experienced when eating.
back_cards.example_en: The soup has a rich, spicy taste I love.

back_cards.definition_en: A small sample or experience of something.
back_cards.example_en: Can I have a taste of your ice cream?

back_cards.definition_en: A preference or liking for something.
back_cards.example_en: She has great taste in music and art.

back_cards.definition_en: The ability to discern quality or style.
back_cards.example_en: His taste in fashion is always on point.

back_cards.definition_en: A brief encounter or try of something.
back_cards.example_en: I got a taste of city life during my trip.

back_cards.definition_en: To politely refuse or turn down something.
back_cards.example_en: She had to decline the invitation due to work.

back_cards.definition_en: A decrease or reduction in amount or quality.
back_cards.example_en: There’s been a decline in sales this month.

back_cards.definition_en: To weaken or deteriorate over time.
back_cards.example_en: His health began to decline after the illness.

back_cards.definition_en: A gradual drop or downward trend.
back_cards.example_en: The decline in air quality is concerning.

back_cards.definition_en: To say no to an offer or request.
back_cards.example_en: He declined to comment on the news story.

back_cards.definition_en: To draw interest or attention to something.
back_cards.example_en: The bright colors attract customers to the store.

back_cards.definition_en: To pull something closer, like a magnet.
back_cards.example_en: The magnet can attract small metal objects.

back_cards.definition_en: To appeal to someone emotionally or romantically.
back_cards.example_en: His confidence is what attracts people to him.

back_cards.definition_en: To bring in or invite opportunities.
back_cards.example_en: The festival attracts thousands of visitors each year.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause something to come toward you.
back_cards.example_en: Sweet flowers attract bees in the garden.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of laughter or amusement.
back_cards.example_en: ‘Ha, that joke was hilarious!’ she laughed.

back_cards.definition_en: A sound showing surprise or realization.
back_cards.example_en: ‘Ha! I knew I left my keys here!’

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express mild disbelief or sarcasm.
back_cards.example_en: ‘Ha, you think you’ll finish that by tonight?’

back_cards.definition_en: A short exclamation to get attention.
back_cards.example_en: ‘Ha, look at that dog chasing its tail!’

back_cards.definition_en: A casual way to acknowledge something funny.
back_cards.example_en: ‘He tripped again?’ ‘Ha, typical!’

back_cards.definition_en: The people living together in one home.
back_cards.example_en: Our household includes two kids and a dog.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the management of a home.
back_cards.example_en: Household chores like dishes take up my evenings.

back_cards.definition_en: A common item used in homes.
back_cards.example_en: This cleaner is a household favorite for stains.

back_cards.definition_en: The collective members of a family unit.
back_cards.example_en: The entire household gathered for the holiday.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing something familiar to most homes.
back_cards.example_en: That brand is a household name for appliances.

back_cards.definition_en: To take air in and out of the lungs.
back_cards.example_en: Just breathe deeply to calm yourself down.

back_cards.definition_en: To exhale or emit something, like air.
back_cards.example_en: The dragon in the story could breathe fire.

back_cards.definition_en: To feel free or relaxed in a space.
back_cards.example_en: This open room lets the house breathe.

back_cards.definition_en: To speak or whisper something softly.
back_cards.example_en: She could barely breathe the words of apology.

back_cards.definition_en: To give life or energy to something.
back_cards.example_en: His passion breathes new life into the project.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being or living.
back_cards.example_en: The existence of life on Mars is still debated.

back_cards.definition_en: The fact of something being real.
back_cards.example_en: She questioned the existence of true love.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of living or being present.
back_cards.example_en: Their quiet existence in the countryside suited them.

back_cards.definition_en: The continuation or survival of something.
back_cards.example_en: The organization fights for the existence of rare species.

back_cards.definition_en: The reality or presence of an idea.
back_cards.example_en: The existence of this law protects workers’ rights.

back_cards.definition_en: A surface that reflects an image.
back_cards.example_en: She checked her outfit in the bathroom mirror.

back_cards.definition_en: To reflect or show something clearly.
back_cards.example_en: His actions mirror his true feelings.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for self-reflection or evaluation.
back_cards.example_en: The book was a mirror of her own struggles.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that copies or resembles another.
back_cards.example_en: The lake’s surface was a mirror for the stars.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to represent truth or reality.
back_cards.example_en: Her art holds a mirror to society’s issues.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who flies an aircraft.
back_cards.example_en: The pilot announced we’d land in ten minutes.

back_cards.definition_en: A trial or test run of something.
back_cards.example_en: The company launched a pilot program for new hires.

back_cards.definition_en: To guide or steer something, like a project.
back_cards.example_en: She’ll pilot the team through the new initiative.

back_cards.definition_en: The operator of a ship or boat.
back_cards.example_en: The pilot navigated the ship through the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: An experimental episode of a TV show.
back_cards.example_en: The show’s pilot got great reviews from viewers.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling of ease after stress or pain.
back_cards.example_en: Finishing the exam was such a relief.

back_cards.definition_en: Help or aid given to those in need.
back_cards.example_en: The charity sent relief to the flood victims.

back_cards.definition_en: A break or rest from something difficult.
back_cards.example_en: The substitute gave the teacher some relief.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that reduces discomfort or burden.
back_cards.example_en: This medicine provides relief from headaches.

back_cards.definition_en: A contrast or highlight, as in art.
back_cards.example_en: The sculpture’s relief made the details pop.

back_cards.definition_en: A white liquid produced by mammals for nourishment.
back_cards.example_en: I poured some milk into my cereal.

back_cards.definition_en: To extract or take advantage of something.
back_cards.example_en: He tried to milk the situation for more attention.

back_cards.definition_en: A dairy product used in cooking or drinks.
back_cards.example_en: The recipe calls for a cup of milk.

back_cards.definition_en: To draw out or use something gradually.
back_cards.example_en: She milked every last drop of fun from the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: A common beverage in many households.
back_cards.example_en: Kids often drink milk with their cookies.

back_cards.definition_en: A statement about a possible danger.
back_cards.example_en: The weather report gave a warning about the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: A notice to alert someone to be cautious.
back_cards.example_en: He ignored the warning about the icy roads.

back_cards.definition_en: A signal or sign of potential trouble.
back_cards.example_en: Her headache was a warning of exhaustion.

back_cards.definition_en: An advisory to prevent harm or error.
back_cards.example_en: The label has a warning about side effects.

back_cards.definition_en: A caution given to correct behavior.
back_cards.example_en: The teacher gave a warning to the noisy class.

back_cards.definition_en: A place or state of eternal happiness.
back_cards.example_en: She felt like heaven after a long, relaxing bath.

back_cards.definition_en: The sky or celestial realm above.
back_cards.example_en: The stars in the heaven sparkled brightly tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: A religious concept of paradise or afterlife.
back_cards.example_en: He believes his dog is now in heaven.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of great joy or delight.
back_cards.example_en: This chocolate cake is absolute heaven!

back_cards.definition_en: A perfect or ideal situation.
back_cards.example_en: Living by the beach is heaven for her.

back_cards.definition_en: To move smoothly, like water or liquid.
back_cards.example_en: The river’s flow was calm after the rain.

back_cards.definition_en: The movement or rhythm of something.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech had a natural flow that captivated us.

back_cards.definition_en: To proceed effortlessly or continuously.
back_cards.example_en: Ideas seem to flow when I’m in the shower.

back_cards.definition_en: A steady stream or supply of something.
back_cards.example_en: The flow of traffic slowed during rush hour.

back_cards.definition_en: To blend seamlessly, like in music or dance.
back_cards.example_en: The dancers’ movements flow so gracefully.

back_cards.definition_en: In a true or exact sense, without exaggeration.
back_cards.example_en: I was literally starving after skipping breakfast.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to emphasize something strongly.
back_cards.example_en: She was literally glued to her phone all day.

back_cards.definition_en: In a word-for-word or precise manner.
back_cards.example_en: He translated the text literally, keeping every word.

back_cards.definition_en: To describe something as it actually happened.
back_cards.example_en: The room was literally freezing with no heat.

back_cards.definition_en: Used for emphasis, even if not fully accurate.
back_cards.example_en: I literally died laughing at that joke.

back_cards.definition_en: To stop doing something or give it up.
back_cards.example_en: She decided to quit smoking for her health.

back_cards.definition_en: To leave a job or position.
back_cards.example_en: He quit his job to start his own business.

back_cards.definition_en: To abandon or walk away from something.
back_cards.example_en: Don’t quit now; you’re so close to finishing!

back_cards.definition_en: To stop trying or give up effort.
back_cards.example_en: I won’t quit until this puzzle is solved.

back_cards.definition_en: To end or cease an activity.
back_cards.example_en: They quit arguing when they realized it was pointless.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of energy in food or drink.
back_cards.example_en: This soda has 150 calories per can.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure used in nutrition tracking.
back_cards.example_en: She counts every calorie to stay on her diet.

back_cards.definition_en: Energy needed to fuel the body.
back_cards.example_en: Running burns more calories than walking.

back_cards.definition_en: A factor in weight management.
back_cards.example_en: Eating fewer calories helped him lose weight.

back_cards.definition_en: A component of food labels.
back_cards.example_en: The label says this snack is low in calories.

back_cards.definition_en: A small object that grows into a plant.
back_cards.example_en: She planted tomato seeds in her garden.

back_cards.definition_en: The start or origin of something.
back_cards.example_en: That conversation planted the seed for a new idea.

back_cards.definition_en: A competitor ranked in a tournament.
back_cards.example_en: He’s the top seed in the tennis championship.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that sparks growth or change.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech was the seed for the movement.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of future development.
back_cards.example_en: Reading books as a kid was the seed of her success.

back_cards.definition_en: Very large in size, amount, or extent.
back_cards.example_en: The desert stretched across a vast expanse of land.

back_cards.definition_en: Huge in scope or scale.
back_cards.example_en: The library holds a vast collection of rare books.

back_cards.definition_en: Immense or boundless, often overwhelming.
back_cards.example_en: Her knowledge of history is vast and impressive.

back_cards.definition_en: Extremely wide or far-reaching.
back_cards.example_en: The ocean’s vast beauty took my breath away.

back_cards.definition_en: Great in number or quantity.
back_cards.example_en: A vast number of stars lit up the night sky.

back_cards.definition_en: A bicycle used for riding or exercise.
back_cards.example_en: I ride my bike to work every morning.

back_cards.definition_en: Short for motorcycle, a motorized vehicle.
back_cards.example_en: His new bike can go over 100 miles per hour.

back_cards.definition_en: To travel or move by bicycle.
back_cards.example_en: We biked through the park on a sunny day.

back_cards.definition_en: A common mode of transport in cities.
back_cards.example_en: The city added bike lanes for safer commuting.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of equipment for outdoor fun.
back_cards.example_en: The kids grabbed their bikes and raced around.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Germany or its people.
back_cards.example_en: She’s taking a German language class this year.

back_cards.definition_en: A person from Germany.
back_cards.example_en: The German at the café recommended a great beer.

back_cards.definition_en: The language spoken in Germany.
back_cards.example_en: He speaks fluent German after living in Berlin.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing culture or traditions from Germany.
back_cards.example_en: The festival featured German music and food.

back_cards.definition_en: Something originating from Germany.
back_cards.example_en: This German car is known for its reliability.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or company that hires workers.
back_cards.example_en: My employer offers great health benefits.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who provides jobs or work.
back_cards.example_en: Her employer promoted her to manager.

back_cards.definition_en: The entity paying for services or labor.
back_cards.example_en: The employer requires all staff to attend training.

back_cards.definition_en: A business or organization with employees.
back_cards.example_en: This employer is known for a great work culture.

back_cards.definition_en: The one in charge of a workplace.
back_cards.example_en: He asked his employer for a day off.

back_cards.definition_en: To pull something along with effort.
back_cards.example_en: He had to drag the heavy box upstairs.

back_cards.definition_en: To move slowly or take too long.
back_cards.example_en: The meeting seemed to drag on forever.

back_cards.definition_en: A form of performance art with exaggerated costumes.
back_cards.example_en: She performed in a drag show last weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: To force or persuade someone reluctantly.
back_cards.example_en: I had to drag him to the family reunion.

back_cards.definition_en: A boring or tedious experience.
back_cards.example_en: Doing dishes every night is such a drag.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to specialized knowledge or skills.
back_cards.example_en: The job requires technical expertise in coding.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving the mechanics of a process or system.
back_cards.example_en: We ran into a technical issue with the printer.

back_cards.definition_en: Detailed or specific to a particular field.
back_cards.example_en: The manual is full of technical jargon.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to technology or equipment.
back_cards.example_en: The team fixed a technical glitch in the app.

back_cards.definition_en: Requiring precise or complex methods.
back_cards.example_en: Her technical skills made the project a success.

back_cards.definition_en: A sudden event causing great damage.
back_cards.example_en: The hurricane was a disaster for the coastal town.

back_cards.definition_en: A complete failure or terrible outcome.
back_cards.example_en: My attempt at baking was a total disaster.

back_cards.definition_en: A catastrophe affecting many people.
back_cards.example_en: The earthquake left the city in a state of disaster.

back_cards.definition_en: An unexpected and destructive incident.
back_cards.example_en: The fire was a disaster that destroyed the factory.

back_cards.definition_en: A mess or problem that’s hard to fix.
back_cards.example_en: His presentation was a disaster with no preparation.

back_cards.definition_en: To show or present something publicly.
back_cards.example_en: The museum will display rare artifacts this month.

back_cards.definition_en: A screen or monitor showing information.
back_cards.example_en: The phone’s display cracked when it fell.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of demonstrating or exhibiting.
back_cards.example_en: Her display of courage inspired everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: To arrange items for viewing, like in a store.
back_cards.example_en: The shop’s display of flowers attracted customers.

back_cards.definition_en: A public performance or show.
back_cards.example_en: The fireworks display lit up the night sky.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of selling something.
back_cards.example_en: The sale of her old car went smoothly.

back_cards.definition_en: An event where goods are sold at a discount.
back_cards.example_en: The store’s big sale starts tomorrow morning.

back_cards.definition_en: The exchange of goods for money.
back_cards.example_en: The sale of the house took months to finalize.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of reduced prices in retail.
back_cards.example_en: I bought these shoes during the holiday sale.

back_cards.definition_en: The total amount of goods sold.
back_cards.example_en: Our lemonade stand had great sales today.

back_cards.definition_en: A room with a toilet and sink.
back_cards.example_en: The bathroom needs cleaning before guests arrive.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for personal hygiene activities.
back_cards.example_en: I’m remodeling the bathroom with new tiles.

back_cards.definition_en: A restroom in a public or private space.
back_cards.example_en: Where’s the nearest bathroom in this mall?

back_cards.definition_en: A room with a shower or bathtub.
back_cards.example_en: She soaked in the bathroom tub after work.

back_cards.definition_en: A space for grooming or washing.
back_cards.example_en: The kids left toys all over the bathroom.

back_cards.definition_en: To achieve a goal or desired outcome.
back_cards.example_en: She worked hard to succeed in her exams.

back_cards.definition_en: To do well in a task or endeavor.
back_cards.example_en: The new product launch succeeded beyond expectations.

back_cards.definition_en: To prosper or thrive in an effort.
back_cards.example_en: He’s determined to succeed as an entrepreneur.

back_cards.definition_en: To follow or take over, as in a role.
back_cards.example_en: She will succeed her boss as the new manager.

back_cards.definition_en: To accomplish something successfully.
back_cards.example_en: With teamwork, we can succeed in this project.

back_cards.definition_en: Acting or done in the same way over time.
back_cards.example_en: Her consistent effort led to great results.

back_cards.definition_en: Reliable or steady in performance.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a consistent player, always scoring points.

back_cards.definition_en: In agreement or harmony with something.
back_cards.example_en: Her story is consistent with the evidence.

back_cards.definition_en: Uniform or unchanging in approach.
back_cards.example_en: The chef’s dishes are consistent in quality.

back_cards.definition_en: Regularly following a pattern or standard.
back_cards.example_en: Daily practice keeps her skills consistent.

back_cards.definition_en: A list of topics or tasks to address.
back_cards.example_en: The meeting’s agenda includes budget planning.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan or goal someone wants to achieve.
back_cards.example_en: His agenda is to improve workplace safety.

back_cards.definition_en: A schedule of events or activities.
back_cards.example_en: The conference agenda is packed with workshops.

back_cards.definition_en: A hidden motive or underlying intention.
back_cards.example_en: She suspected he had a personal agenda.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of priorities for discussion.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s stick to the agenda and avoid distractions.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of ensuring laws or rules are followed.
back_cards.example_en: The police handle the enforcement of traffic laws.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of making sure policies are obeyed.
back_cards.example_en: Enforcement of the dress code starts Monday.

back_cards.definition_en: Actions to uphold regulations or standards.
back_cards.example_en: Strict enforcement reduced littering in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: The authority to implement rules or penalties.
back_cards.example_en: The agency oversees enforcement of safety guidelines.

back_cards.definition_en: Efforts to maintain compliance in a system.
back_cards.example_en: Enforcement of the new tax law caused debates.

back_cards.definition_en: The food and drink a person consumes.
back_cards.example_en: Her diet includes lots of fruits and vegetables.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan to eat specific foods for health.
back_cards.example_en: He’s on a diet to lose weight before summer.

back_cards.definition_en: A restricted eating plan for a purpose.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor recommended a low-salt diet.

back_cards.definition_en: The usual food of a group or culture.
back_cards.example_en: A Mediterranean diet is rich in olive oil.

back_cards.definition_en: To follow a specific eating regimen.
back_cards.example_en: She diets every January to start fresh.

back_cards.definition_en: The absence of sound or noise.
back_cards.example_en: The silence in the forest was calming.

back_cards.definition_en: A refusal to speak or respond.
back_cards.example_en: His silence during the argument was deafening.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of quiet or stillness.
back_cards.example_en: We sat in silence, enjoying the sunset.

back_cards.definition_en: To stop or suppress sound or speech.
back_cards.example_en: She raised her hand to silence the crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of being unheard or ignored.
back_cards.example_en: Her concerns were met with silence from the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who reports news or writes articles.
back_cards.example_en: The journalist covered the election for the newspaper.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who investigates and shares stories.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a journalist known for exposing corruption.

back_cards.definition_en: A writer for media, like TV or online.
back_cards.example_en: The journalist interviewed locals about the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional who gathers and presents information.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a sports journalist covering the playoffs.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who documents events or issues.
back_cards.example_en: The journalist traveled to report on the crisis.

back_cards.definition_en: The sacred book of Christianity.
back_cards.example_en: She reads the Bible every morning for inspiration.

back_cards.definition_en: A key text for religious teachings.
back_cards.example_en: The pastor quoted the Bible during the sermon.

back_cards.definition_en: A definitive guide or authority on something.
back_cards.example_en: This cookbook is the Bible for Italian recipes.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific edition of the Christian scriptures.
back_cards.example_en: Her family’s Bible has been passed down for generations.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of moral or spiritual guidance.
back_cards.example_en: He treats his father’s advice like a Bible.

back_cards.definition_en: A female ruler of a kingdom.
back_cards.example_en: The queen addressed the nation on television.

back_cards.definition_en: A woman admired for her excellence.
back_cards.example_en: She’s the queen of baking in our family.

back_cards.definition_en: A playing card with a female figure.
back_cards.example_en: He played the queen of hearts in the game.

back_cards.definition_en: The most powerful piece in chess.
back_cards.example_en: She moved her queen to checkmate her opponent.

back_cards.definition_en: A celebrated figure in a specific field.
back_cards.example_en: Beyoncé is a queen in the music industry.

back_cards.definition_en: To split something into parts or sections.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s divide the pizza evenly among us.

back_cards.definition_en: To separate people or groups with differing views.
back_cards.example_en: The issue continues to divide the community.

back_cards.definition_en: To share or distribute something.
back_cards.example_en: We’ll divide the tasks to finish faster.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause disagreement or conflict.
back_cards.example_en: Politics can divide even the closest friends.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform mathematical division.
back_cards.example_en: She taught the kids how to divide numbers.

back_cards.definition_en: The cost or money spent on something.
back_cards.example_en: The trip was worth the expense for the memories.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial burden or outlay.
back_cards.example_en: Renting an apartment is a big expense.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that requires payment.
back_cards.example_en: Car repairs were an unexpected expense this month.

back_cards.definition_en: Money used for a specific purpose.
back_cards.example_en: She tracked every expense during her vacation.

back_cards.definition_en: A sacrifice or cost, not always financial.
back_cards.example_en: He succeeded at the expense of his free time.

back_cards.definition_en: A thick, fatty part of milk used in food.
back_cards.example_en: She added cream to her coffee for richness.

back_cards.definition_en: A product for skin or cosmetic use.
back_cards.example_en: This cream helps with dry skin in winter.

back_cards.definition_en: The best or most desirable part.
back_cards.example_en: He’s the cream of the crop in our class.

back_cards.definition_en: A soft, spreadable food, like whipped cream.
back_cards.example_en: The cake was topped with fresh whipped cream.

back_cards.definition_en: A color resembling light yellow or white.
back_cards.example_en: Her dress was a soft cream shade.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being in contact with something.
back_cards.example_en: Exposure to the sun caused her sunburn.

back_cards.definition_en: Publicity or attention in media.
back_cards.example_en: The band gained exposure after their viral video.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of revealing or uncovering something.
back_cards.example_en: His exposure of the scam saved many people.

back_cards.definition_en: The amount of light in photography.
back_cards.example_en: The photo’s exposure was perfect for the sunset.

back_cards.definition_en: Being open to risk or danger.
back_cards.example_en: Camping in the cold left us at risk of exposure.

back_cards.definition_en: Something given importance over other things.
back_cards.example_en: Finishing this report is my top priority today.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being first or most urgent.
back_cards.example_en: Safety is the priority during the construction.

back_cards.definition_en: A task or goal ranked highest.
back_cards.example_en: Her priority is to save for a new car.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that takes precedence in planning.
back_cards.example_en: The team set clear priorities for the project.

back_cards.definition_en: A focus on what matters most.
back_cards.example_en: Family is always his number one priority.

back_cards.definition_en: The top layer of earth where plants grow.
back_cards.example_en: She tested the soil before planting her garden.

back_cards.definition_en: To make something dirty or stained.
back_cards.example_en: His shoes soiled the clean kitchen floor.

back_cards.definition_en: The ground or land of a specific area.
back_cards.example_en: The farm’s soil is rich and perfect for crops.

back_cards.definition_en: A medium for growing plants or crops.
back_cards.example_en: This soil needs more nutrients for better yield.

back_cards.definition_en: The foundation for agriculture or gardening.
back_cards.example_en: Healthy soil is key to a thriving garden.

back_cards.definition_en: A spiritual being or messenger of God.
back_cards.example_en: She believes an angel watches over her family.

back_cards.definition_en: A kind or helpful person.
back_cards.example_en: You’re an angel for helping me move today.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of affection or admiration.
back_cards.example_en: Her little girl is such an angel when she sleeps.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of goodness or purity.
back_cards.example_en: The angel on the Christmas tree glowed brightly.

back_cards.definition_en: A figure in art or stories representing hope.
back_cards.example_en: The painting featured an angel with golden wings.

back_cards.definition_en: A trip or travel from one place to another.
back_cards.example_en: The journey to the mountains took six hours.

back_cards.definition_en: A process of personal growth or change.
back_cards.example_en: Her journey to self-confidence was inspiring.

back_cards.definition_en: An adventure or experience over time.
back_cards.example_en: Starting a business was a challenging journey.

back_cards.definition_en: A long trip, often with a purpose.
back_cards.example_en: Their journey across Europe was unforgettable.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphorical path through life or events.
back_cards.example_en: His journey through grief took years to heal.

back_cards.definition_en: Closely connected or appropriate to the matter.
back_cards.example_en: Her experience is relevant to the job opening.

back_cards.definition_en: Having significance or importance.
back_cards.example_en: Please share only relevant details in the report.

back_cards.definition_en: Applicable or related to a topic.
back_cards.example_en: His comments were relevant to our discussion.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertinent to current events or issues.
back_cards.example_en: This article is relevant to today’s economic trends.

back_cards.definition_en: Useful or meaningful in a context.
back_cards.example_en: The data is relevant for planning the event.

back_cards.definition_en: A large container for holding liquid or gas.
back_cards.example_en: The fish tank needs cleaning this weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: A military vehicle with heavy armor.
back_cards.example_en: The tank rolled through the battlefield with ease.

back_cards.definition_en: To fail completely or perform poorly.
back_cards.example_en: The movie tanked at the box office.

back_cards.definition_en: A storage unit for fuel or water.
back_cards.example_en: The car’s gas tank is almost empty.

back_cards.definition_en: A sleeveless shirt, often casual.
back_cards.example_en: She wore a tank top to the gym.

back_cards.definition_en: A food made from pressed milk curds.
back_cards.example_en: I made a sandwich with cheddar cheese.

back_cards.definition_en: A smile or pose for a photo.
back_cards.example_en: Say ‘cheese’ for the camera, everyone!

back_cards.definition_en: Something cheap or of low quality.
back_cards.example_en: That movie was so cheesy, but I loved it.

back_cards.definition_en: A variety of dairy product used in cooking.
back_cards.example_en: The pizza is loaded with extra cheese.

back_cards.definition_en: An exaggerated or silly expression.
back_cards.example_en: His cheesy grin made us all laugh.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan of tasks or events with times.
back_cards.example_en: My schedule is packed with meetings today.

back_cards.definition_en: To arrange or plan for a specific time.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s schedule the party for next Saturday.

back_cards.definition_en: A list of times for activities or transport.
back_cards.example_en: The train schedule shows a departure at 6 PM.

back_cards.definition_en: A timeline for completing a project.
back_cards.example_en: We’re behind schedule on the construction.

back_cards.definition_en: A routine or agenda for daily tasks.
back_cards.example_en: Her workout schedule includes yoga every morning.

back_cards.definition_en: A room used for sleeping.
back_cards.example_en: The bedroom has a cozy bed and soft lighting.

back_cards.definition_en: A private space for rest or relaxation.
back_cards.example_en: She painted her bedroom a calming blue.

back_cards.definition_en: A room in a home for personal use.
back_cards.example_en: The kids share a bedroom with bunk beds.

back_cards.definition_en: A space designed for overnight guests.
back_cards.example_en: We set up the spare bedroom for visitors.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for personal items and rest.
back_cards.example_en: His bedroom is cluttered with books and clothes.

back_cards.definition_en: The sound or quality of someone’s voice.
back_cards.example_en: Her tone was sharp when she was upset.

back_cards.definition_en: The mood or attitude of something.
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s tone was dark and suspenseful.

back_cards.definition_en: A musical or vocal pitch.
back_cards.example_en: He sang in a low, soothing tone.

back_cards.definition_en: The shade or intensity of a color.
back_cards.example_en: The walls were painted in a warm tone.

back_cards.definition_en: To adjust or set the style of something.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech set a hopeful tone for the event.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of choosing something carefully.
back_cards.example_en: Her selection of colors made the room vibrant.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of things chosen from a larger set.
back_cards.example_en: The store has a great selection of wines.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of picking people or items.
back_cards.example_en: The team’s selection for the game was tough.

back_cards.definition_en: Something picked out as the best option.
back_cards.example_en: This book is my selection for the club.

back_cards.definition_en: A range of options available to choose.
back_cards.example_en: The menu’s selection includes vegetarian dishes.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that is ideal or without flaws.
back_cards.example_en: The plan worked perfectly, just as expected.

back_cards.definition_en: Completely or entirely, used for emphasis.
back_cards.example_en: I’m perfectly fine with staying home tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: In an exact or precise manner.
back_cards.example_en: The dress fits her perfectly, no alterations needed.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that suits a situation well.
back_cards.example_en: His skills are perfectly suited for this job.

back_cards.definition_en: Without any errors or mistakes.
back_cards.example_en: She answered every question perfectly.

back_cards.definition_en: A round object that helps something move.
back_cards.example_en: The car’s wheel got stuck in the mud.

back_cards.definition_en: A steering device for a vehicle.
back_cards.example_en: He gripped the wheel tightly during the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: A circular part of a machine or tool.
back_cards.example_en: The potter shaped clay on a spinning wheel.

back_cards.definition_en: To move something on wheels, like a cart.
back_cards.example_en: She wheeled the suitcase through the airport.

back_cards.definition_en: A key component in motion or progress.
back_cards.example_en: The project is moving forward, wheels in motion.

back_cards.definition_en: A space or opening between two things.
back_cards.example_en: There’s a gap in the fence we need to fix.

back_cards.definition_en: A difference or disparity between things.
back_cards.example_en: The pay gap between workers is being addressed.

back_cards.definition_en: A missing part or incomplete section.
back_cards.example_en: Her resume has a gap from when she traveled.

back_cards.definition_en: An opportunity or break in a situation.
back_cards.example_en: We found a gap in the market for our product.

back_cards.definition_en: A divide in understanding or communication.
back_cards.example_en: There’s a gap between what she said and did.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who served in the military.
back_cards.example_en: The veteran shared stories from his time in service.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone with long experience in a field.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a veteran teacher with 20 years in the classroom.

back_cards.definition_en: A former member of the armed forces.
back_cards.example_en: The parade honored veterans from all wars.

back_cards.definition_en: An experienced professional or worker.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a veteran journalist known for tough interviews.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone seasoned by time or practice.
back_cards.example_en: The veteran chef taught us his best recipes.

back_cards.definition_en: To have a different opinion or view.
back_cards.example_en: I disagree with your plan to skip the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: To argue or not be in agreement.
back_cards.example_en: They always disagree about where to eat.

back_cards.definition_en: To not match or be consistent.
back_cards.example_en: Her story disagrees with the facts we know.

back_cards.definition_en: To refuse to support or accept something.
back_cards.example_en: He disagrees with the new company policy.

back_cards.definition_en: To conflict or clash in ideas.
back_cards.example_en: The siblings disagree on how to care for their parents.

back_cards.definition_en: A typical feature or quality of something.
back_cards.example_en: Her optimism is a characteristic I admire.

back_cards.definition_en: A trait that defines a person or thing.
back_cards.example_en: The car’s sleek design is its best characteristic.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that distinguishes or identifies.
back_cards.example_en: The building’s arches are a unique characteristic.

back_cards.definition_en: A property or attribute of an object.
back_cards.example_en: Durability is a characteristic of this fabric.

back_cards.definition_en: A consistent behavior or pattern.
back_cards.example_en: His punctuality is a characteristic of his work ethic.

back_cards.definition_en: A nutrient essential for body growth and repair.
back_cards.example_en: Chicken is a great source of protein for dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: A molecule found in food like meat or beans.
back_cards.example_en: She added protein powder to her smoothie.

back_cards.definition_en: A substance vital for muscle development.
back_cards.example_en: Athletes need more protein to stay strong.

back_cards.definition_en: A component in many healthy diets.
back_cards.example_en: Eggs are packed with protein and easy to cook.

back_cards.definition_en: A biological compound in cells.
back_cards.example_en: The lab studies how protein affects cell growth.

back_cards.definition_en: A firm decision to achieve a goal.
back_cards.example_en: Her New Year’s resolution is to exercise daily.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of solving a problem or dispute.
back_cards.example_en: The team reached a resolution after hours of debate.

back_cards.definition_en: The clarity or quality of an image.
back_cards.example_en: This TV has amazing resolution for movies.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal decision by a group or vote.
back_cards.example_en: The council passed a resolution to fund the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Determination to complete a task.
back_cards.example_en: His resolution to finish the book never wavered.

back_cards.definition_en: To consider or think about in a certain way.
back_cards.example_en: I regard her as my best friend.

back_cards.definition_en: Respect or admiration for someone.
back_cards.example_en: He has high regard for his mentor’s advice.

back_cards.definition_en: To look at or observe closely.
back_cards.example_en: She regarded the painting with curiosity.

back_cards.definition_en: Concerning or relating to something.
back_cards.example_en: In regard to your request, we’ll respond soon.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of care or attention.
back_cards.example_en: They showed little regard for the rules.

back_cards.definition_en: A smaller number of things or people.
back_cards.example_en: Fewer cars on the road made the drive faster.

back_cards.definition_en: Less in quantity, used with countable items.
back_cards.example_en: She has fewer books than her brother.

back_cards.definition_en: A reduced amount compared to before.
back_cards.example_en: There are fewer mistakes in this draft.

back_cards.definition_en: Not as many as expected or needed.
back_cards.example_en: Fewer people showed up to the event.

back_cards.definition_en: A comparative term for countable objects.
back_cards.example_en: I want fewer meetings so I can focus.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who designs or builds machines or structures.
back_cards.example_en: The engineer created a plan for the new bridge.

back_cards.definition_en: To plan or create something skillfully.
back_cards.example_en: She engineered a solution to the software bug.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional in technical fields like electronics.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a software engineer at a tech startup.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who operates or maintains systems.
back_cards.example_en: The train engineer checked the controls.

back_cards.definition_en: To arrange or bring about through careful planning.
back_cards.example_en: They engineered a deal to save the company.

back_cards.definition_en: A plate or container for serving food.
back_cards.example_en: She served pasta on a large ceramic dish.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific type of prepared food.
back_cards.example_en: This restaurant’s signature dish is spicy tacos.

back_cards.definition_en: To share or spread information, often gossip.
back_cards.example_en: Come on, dish the details about the party!

back_cards.definition_en: A shallow, flat container for various uses.
back_cards.example_en: The soap dish keeps the counter clean.

back_cards.definition_en: A particular recipe or culinary creation.
back_cards.example_en: Her lasagna is a dish everyone loves.

back_cards.definition_en: To use something carelessly or without purpose.
back_cards.example_en: Don’t waste water during the drought.

back_cards.definition_en: Material thrown away or not used.
back_cards.example_en: The factory recycles its waste to save resources.

back_cards.definition_en: A loss of time, effort, or resources.
back_cards.example_en: Arguing about it is just a waste of time.

back_cards.definition_en: To squander or fail to use effectively.
back_cards.example_en: He wasted his chance to win the game.

back_cards.definition_en: Unwanted or discarded items.
back_cards.example_en: The trash bin is full of kitchen waste.

back_cards.definition_en: To produce text or images on paper.
back_cards.example_en: I need to print the report before the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: A mark or impression made by pressing.
back_cards.example_en: His fingerprint was clear on the glass.

back_cards.definition_en: Text or graphics from a printer.
back_cards.example_en: The print on this label is too small to read.

back_cards.definition_en: To publish something in written form.
back_cards.example_en: The newspaper will print her article tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: A pattern or design on fabric.
back_cards.example_en: Her dress has a floral print I love.

back_cards.definition_en: A mental health condition with prolonged sadness.
back_cards.example_en: She sought help for her depression last year.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of economic downturn.
back_cards.example_en: The Great Depression affected millions of jobs.

back_cards.definition_en: A low area or dip in the ground.
back_cards.example_en: Rain collected in the depression near the road.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of feeling low or unmotivated.
back_cards.example_en: He fell into a depression after the breakup.

back_cards.definition_en: A reduction in activity or energy.
back_cards.example_en: The market saw a depression in sales this quarter.
